Alpinia Galanga (Rasna): Rasna is used in Ayurveda to treat arthritis and inflammation.
Amaranthus Viridis (Arive-Dantu): This plant is rich in iron and often used to treat anemia and digestive issues.
Artocarpus Heterophyllus (Jackfruit): Jackfruit leaves are believed to help manage diabetes naturally.
Azadirachta Indica (Neem): Neem is known for its antibacterial and antifungal properties in skin and dental care.
Basella Alba (Basale): Basale is high in antioxidants and promotes skin and digestive health.
Brassica Juncea (Indian Mustard): Mustard leaves are used for respiratory relief and improving digestion.
Carissa Carandas (Karanda): Karanda is used traditionally to treat fever, skin infections, and anemia.
Citrus Limon (Lemon): Lemon leaves are rich in vitamin C and aid in digestion and immunity.
Ficus Auriculata (Roxburgh fig): Roxburgh fig leaves help regulate blood sugar and promote liver health.
Ficus Religiosa (Peepal Tree): Peepal leaves are known in Ayurveda for asthma, constipation, and wound healing.
Hibiscus Rosa-sinensis: Hibiscus is used to promote hair growth and manage high blood pressure.
Jasminum (Jasmine): Jasmine leaves are used in treating fever, headaches, and stress.
Mangifera Indica (Mango): Mango leaves are used for diabetes management and improving gut health.
Mentha (Mint): Mint leaves are known for their cooling effect and help with digestion and nausea.
Moringa Oleifera (Drumstick): Moringa leaves are highly nutritious and reduce inflammation and oxidative stress.
Muntingia Calabura (Jamaica Cherry): Jamaica Cherry leaves are used to relieve pain and reduce fever.
Murraya Koenigii (Curry): Curry leaves improve eyesight, control cholesterol, and aid digestion.
Nerium Oleander (Oleander): Used cautiously, oleander extracts have been researched for cancer and heart disease.
Nyctanthes Arbor-tristis (Parijata): Parijata is valued for its anti-inflammatory and antipyretic properties.
Ocimum Tenuiflorum (Tulsi): Tulsi is revered in Ayurveda for respiratory health and immunity boosting.
Piper Betle (Betel): Betel leaves help in oral hygiene and aid digestion with antimicrobial benefits.
Plectranthus Amboinicus (Mexican Mint): Mexican Mint is used for treating coughs, asthma, and sore throat.
Pongamia Pinnata (Indian Beech): Indian Beech is traditionally used to treat skin diseases and wounds.
Psidium Guajava (Guava): Guava leaves help manage diabetes and promote oral and digestive health.
Punica Granatum (Pomegranate): Pomegranate leaves are used for diarrhea, ulcers, and antioxidant support.
Santalum Album (Sandalwood): Sandalwood leaves have cooling and antimicrobial properties in skin care.
Syzygium Cumini (Jamun): Jamun leaves are effective for controlling blood sugar levels in diabetes.
Syzygium Jambos (Rose Apple): Rose Apple leaves have astringent properties and are used to treat diarrhea.
Tabernaemontana Divaricata (Crape Jasmin: Crape Jasmine is known for anti-inflammatory and pain-relieving effects.
Trigonella Foenum-graecum (Fenugreek): Fenugreek leaves help lower blood sugar and aid in digestion.
